awd_abstract_narration: This is a Presidential Young Investigator award.  The research                  will include continued development of instrumentation and testing               devices in the area of geotechnical engineering, as well as                     expansion of involvement in hazardous waste engineering.  Current               research dealing with the development of ultrasonic crack                       detection for a new in situ stress measurement system will                      continue.                                                                                                                                                       Work in the hazardous waste area will diverge into two areas.                   First, development of a cone penetration device (Envirocone) that               allows ground water and vadose zone sampling, and second, a                     combined program with several biologists yielding several                       projects; including a biosensor for the Envirocone to detect                    trace carcinogens, a laboratory model to study biocontamination                 of geotextiles, and a potential technique to electro-osmotically                move bacteria through soil.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA
